author: Special Correspondent
text:
Painting competition held for students on the banks of Ossudu Lake

Schoolchildren take part in the State-level painting competition organised by the Central Ground Water Board at Ossudu Lake on Saturday in Puducherry.— Photo: S.S. Kumar

With an aim to motivate children towards protection of water resources, its augmentation, conservation, recycling and reuse, the Central Ground Water Board organised a State-level painting competition on Thursday here on the banks of Ossudu Lake.

The nation-wide painting competitions for schoolchildren are being organised by CGWB since 2010.

Over 48 students participated in the school level competition. After the competition, a board of Jury selected first three prizes and 10 consolation prizes.

V. Hemachandran, VIII Standard student of Amalorpavam Higher Secondary School, Vanrampet, received the first prize of Rs. 5,000. Asihika J.S., VIII Standard of St. Joseph Cluny Higher Secondary received Rs. 3,000 for the second place and A. Sugumaran, Government Higher Secondary, Thiruvandarkoil got Rs. 2,000 in cash as thrid prize.

Nearly 10 participants received Rs.1,000 each as consolation prizes.

Chief Minister N. Rangasamy distributed the prizes to the winners.

Education Minister T. Thiagarajan and Director of School Education L. Kumar, felicitated the participants.

Each participant of the school and State-level painting competitions were given participation certificates and winners were awarded certificate of merit.
title: Motivating children to protect water resources
